Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

In the text below, text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.

In the text below, any inserted strings - anything of the form {text} - is replaced by an integer value for the thing described in the brackets. If the {text} is not followed by a unit - e.g. shields, hitpoints - the icon for the unit is inserted together with the integer. The same holds for symbols - e.g. '+', '%' - which are occasionally inserted together with the integer.
For references to game terminology and in-world references, please check the glossary delivered as part of the documentation.
A vein in this context can also be called a crack. The Exposed Mineral Vein is basically a giant crack within the ground which contains a lot of minerals for mining.

A vein of minerals has been pushed up to the surface by tectonic activity. Grants {Production} Production to the colony it is linked to.[br/][br/]Grants an additional {SynergyProduction} Production when in a Production Exploitation.
Production Exploitation refers to the sector upgrade that players can built from a colony.

The Soul Beacon is an ancient Heritor device used to sap Essence on a large scale and redistribute them among the owner's troops. [br/][br/]While within this sector: [bulletList][bullet][abilityred]Enemy[/abilityred] units do not regain [hp/] out of combat.[/bullet] [bullet][abilityblue]Friendly[/abilityblue] units heal to full [hp/] at the start of each strategic turn.[/bullet]
“Heritor” is a the new secret tech introduced in Planetfall’s first expansion. “Essence” refers to an type of life force/energy that is repeatedly mentioned within the Heritor secret technology.

Every {turns}[turn/] combat turns: [bulletList][bullet]Each [abilityred]enemy[/abilityred] unit has a {strength}[strengthentropy/] strength chance to suffer [abilityred]Energy Drained[/abilityred] for {drainedturns} [turn/].[/bullet] [bullet]In addition, each [abilityblue]friendly[/abilityblue] unit gains an [abilityblue]Essence Charge[/abilityblue].[/bullet]
Out of combat means within the world map. And strategic turn also means a turn within the world map. Combat turn refers to a turn within tactical combat.
The Cluster Mine Launcher uses a relatively primitive but effective system that harasses enemy troops by launching mines in the enemy's close vicinity. [br/][br/]While within this sector:

Every {turns}[turn/] combat turn: [bulletList][bullet]{mineamount} mines will be placed at random locations in the map.[/bullet] [bullet][abilityred]Enemy[/abilityred] non-Flying, non-Floating units passing over or starting their turn on a mine get a {strength}[strengthphysical/] strength chance to suffer {minedamage}[damagekinetic/] damage.[/bullet][bullet][abilityblue]Friendly[/abilityblue] units are not affected by the mines.[/bullet]
Out of combat means within the world map. And strategic turn also means a turn within the world map. Combat turn refers to a turn within tactical combat.

The Firestorm Missile Silo is an automated installation which launches thermal missiles at hostile entities during engagements. They were often part of Purifier forward bases. [br/][br/]While within this sector:

Every {turns}[turn/] combat turns: [bulletList][bullet]A random enemy unit gains [abilityred]Firestorm Missile Lock.[/abilityred][/bullet][bulletList] [bullet]After another turn, that unit will be struck by a Firestorm Missile.[/bullet] [bullet]Firestorm Missile deals {damagecenter}[damagethermal/] damage with [abilityred]Massive Impact[/abilityred] on the center target hex.[/bullet] [bullet]It also deals {damage2}[damagethermal/] with [abilityred]High Impact[/abilityred] within a 2 hex radius.[/bullet] [bullet]Additionally, it will leave fire hazards on all affected hexes.[/bullet]
Out of combat means within the world map. And strategic turn also means a turn within the world map. Combat turn refers to a turn within tactical combat.

Every {turns}[turn/] turns: [bulletList][bullet]A random enemy unit gains [abilityred]Firestorm Missile Lock.[/abilityred][/bullet][bulletList] [bullet] After another turn, said unit will be struck by a Firestorm Missile.[/bullet] [bullet]Firestorm Missile deals {damagecenter}[damagethermal/] damage with [abilityred]Massive Impact[abilityred/] on the center target hex.[/bullet] [bullet]It also deals {damage2}[damagethermal/] with [abilityred]High Impact[/abilityred] within a 2 hex radius.[/bullet][bullet]Additionally, it will leave fire hazards on all affected hexes.[/bullet]
Out of combat means within the world map. And strategic turn also means a turn within the world map. Combat turn refers to a turn within tactical combat.

This unit is locked onto by the [abilityred]Firestorm Missile Silo[/abilityred]. It will be hit by a Firestorm Missile at the start of the next turn, hitting both this unit and any other unit within a 2 hex radius.[br/][br/]If the unit dies before this status expires, no missile will be fired.
Out of combat means within the world map. And strategic turn also means a turn within the world map. Combat turn refers to a turn within tactical combat.
Es’Teq is an ancient society that is part of the Heritor secret technology. “Essence” refers to an type of life force/energy that is repeatedly mentioned within the Heritor secret technology.
The Es'Teq Essence Pool is an ancient ritual place that has reemerged after lying dormant for an undefined amount of time. It is used to bestow Essence draining infusions upon weaponry.
Es’Teq is an ancient society that is part of the Heritor secret technology. “Essence” refers to an type of life force/energy that is repeatedly mentioned within the Heritor secret technology.

Grants [abilityblue]Es'Teq Enhancements[/abilityblue] for the next combat, granting them {strength} [abilityred]Energy Drain[/abilityred] on their non-[damageentropy/]Entropy attacks. [br/][br/]The Es'teq Essence Pool grants {Income} when it's within a colony's domain.
Entropy is a new damage channel featured in Planetfall’s first expansion.
The Heritor Sanctorum's sacred underground vaults contain massive complexes that in turn are filled with hieroglyphs and imagery of Heritor history and prophesies alike.
Heritor refers to the new secret technology that is featured in Planetfall’s first expansion

This landmark is an advanced energy sector, and gives the following when annexed:[br/]{EnergyFlat}, {EnergySlot}.[br/]{ResearchFlat}, {ResearchSlot}.[br/][br/]In addition, it unlocks the following building in your colony: [hyperlink,000003E4000002B0]Crystal Altar[/hyperlink]

Every {turns}[turn/], the Sanctorum's Overflowing Essence provides for all... for a price.[br/]Attacking units with Essence Charges lose {Essenceloss} Essence Charge, units without essence charges have a {OverflowingEssenceStrength}[strengthentropy/] strength chance to suffer [abilityred]Etropic Decay[/abilityred] for {Duration}[turn/]. Any defending units with Essence charges gain {OverflowingEssenceHeal}[HP/] per essence charge.

A Sun Shard crashed into the surface. It provides [abilityblue]Unwavering Will[/abilityblue] to units built in the owning colony.[br/][br/]The Sun Shard adds {Research} when it is within a colony's domain.
An excavated estate that belonged to the Valentine family. Its extravagant exterior shelters a large weapons development plant, which used to provide cutting edge weaponry to the Star Union.
This landmark is an advanced production sector, and gives the following when annexed:[br/]{ProductionFlat}, {ProductionSlot}.[br/]{ResearchFlat}, {ResearchSlot}.
Every [turn/] the Forgotten guardians of the Es'teq stir, causing one of the previously slumbering Golems to awaken and join the defense.
"There could be no faults, no lack of offerings, nothing less than perfection for our High Lords to accommodate their slumber." - Final vow of the faithful
"More than mere cultists, the Es'Teq had become architects of immortality, as long as their followers remained willing." - General Ashen, RPR tactician
